_metadata.name: Metadiscourse Markers Lexicon (Enriched)
sources: Hyland (2005) - Metadiscourse: Exploring Interaction in Writing
Hyland & Tse (2004) - Metadiscourse in Academic Writing: A Reappraisal
Crismore (1989) - Talking with Readers: Metadiscourse as Rhetorical Act
Li et al. (2024) - RAAMove Corpus (rhetorical move annotation)
_metadata.description: Hyland's taxonomy enriched with rhetorical move annotations and factuality markers

categories.interactive: Organizing discourse (transitions, frames, endophoric, evidentials, code glosses)
categories.interactional: Engaging reader (hedges, boosters, attitude markers, engagement markers, self-mention)

new_annotations: rhetorical_move: Background, Gap, Purpose, Methodology, Results, Conclusion, Implications, Limitations (RAAMove)
factuality_level: CT+ (certain positive), PS+ (possible positive), etc. (MAVEN-FACT)
discipline_preference: Hyland's corpus findings on disciplinary variation

shocked.note: Strong emotional marker, rare in academic writing

shocking.note: Strong emotional marker, rare in academic writing

shockingly.note: Strong emotional marker, rare in academic writing

unbelievable.note: Very strong marker, extremely rare in formal academic writing

unbelievably.note: Very strong marker, extremely rare in formal academic writing

set.note: Often in procedural instructions: 'set the value to X'

take.note: Often in phrases: 'take a look', 'take as example'

turn.note: Topic shift: 'turn to the next section'
